intro: Anthephora cristata, commonly known as the crested anthephora, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescences and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture. Anthephora cristata is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy.
